sub_title: Economist, Associate Member of Royal Society of Medicine, Author of AI, Pandemic and Healthcare
summary:
She finished an MBA candidate at the University of Amsterdam, and she has a PhD in Global Studies, Justice and Rights from the University of Macerata, Italy. She has also completed an Erasmus Mundus Master's Course of Economic Policy in the Age of Globalization from the University of Paris XIII - Sorbonne, University of Witwatersrand, and Berlin School of Economics and Law. She holds a Bachelor of Economics in International Business from China University of Political Science and Law.

Dr. Chen has worked as a reviewer for the Journal of Medical Informatics and the Journal of Frontiers in Public Health. She is also the founder of Noah's Investment LLC, where she promotes the participation of female traders and has won the Best Investment Strategy Award in the Sustainable Investment Contest. She has worked as a Digital Health Specialist at Numeral Frontier and as a Product Manager at Flexolink, where she developed a use case for brain-to-computer interface technology. She participated in the High Tech XL - Startup Incubator Program Printed Sensor Project and the Marie Curie Fellowship - Secondment at Philips Research Global HQ Population Health Management Department, where she developed a business model fitting the EU and Chinese market for smart health solutions. Additionally, she conducted stakeholder interviews for smart healthcare solutions at Philips Shanghai Research Department. Dr. Chen's research interests include smart healthcare solutions, digital health, telehealth solutions, and global economic policy.
